<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stimulus: </strong></span><span>The House passed and President Trump signed the </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/2099a53bb8adf2def7ee7329ea322f9d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest economic relief bill</a></span><span> in U.S. history, a $2.2 trillion whopper. $1,200 payouts and other financial assistance measures are on their way to many Americans who are suffering from a swift but crushing economic crisis. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Global economy: </strong></span><span>It's </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/3bb2d6810c2f141a0bdecd3e4b49b215?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now in a recession</a></span><span>, said the head of the IMF.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">U.S. markets: </strong></span><span>Despite heavy losses on Friday, the major indexes posted historic weekly gains. The Dow had its </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/26/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">best week</a></span><span> since 1938, when there were more cars on the road than there are now.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REGULATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/government-deregulation-spree-coronavirus-whacks-economy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Deregulation Station
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="stop signal with a coronavirus theme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/382/stop_and_go.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="stop signal with a coronavirus theme" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/382/stop_and_go.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you’re confronting both a) an economic crisis and b) a public health emergency, the last thing you want to do is trip on red tape. This week, the U.S. government relaxed regulations across a number of industries—but not without controversy. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Banks get relief in the relief package</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The $2.2 trillion stimulus bill passed yesterday relaxes some financial crisis-era rules to keep banks lending in these credit-crunched times.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Regulators said banks could ignore a </span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-finance-202/2020/03/26/the-finance-202-banks-win-long-sought-deregulation-in-coronavirus-rescue-package/5e7be6e0602ff10d49ad4bc7/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tough new accounting rule</a></span><span> that requires them to estimate future losses on loans. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Smaller banks won’t need to hold as much cash in reserve until the end of the year or the end of this crisis.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Environmental monitoring</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, the EPA temporarily <a href="https://apnews.com/45fdad55aaa3bccde3d09939c631c208?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relaxed enforcement</a> of environmental rules on polluters like power plants and factories. Citing COVID-19, the agency said it wouldn’t penalize companies that violate the rules because of coronavirus-related challenges. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Supporters say it’s a sensible guideline in the face of uncertainty. Environmental leaders called it a “license to pollute.” </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Fast-tracking medical equipment</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ve heard stories of companies heroically rejiggering their assembly lines to churn out emergency medical products. It’s...a little more complicated than that. Regulators have needed to <a href="https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-continues-facilitate-access-crucial-medical-products-including?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">loosen rules</a> over the production of some life-saving medical equipment. A few examples:  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The FDA won’t enforce its “premarket review” when factories like Ford’s that do not typically make ventilators start making ventilators.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Distillers that pivoted to make hand sanitizer received some waivers from the government. But ethanol producers sitting on millions of gallons of lower-grade alcohol are </span><span><a href="https://wwl.radio.com/articles/ethanol-industry-asks-for-relaxed-regulations-for-sanitizer?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still petitioning</a></span><span> the FDA to let them help out in the effort.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fun note: </strong>Because of the coronavirus, we might even start seeing some midshipmen with mullets. The Navy <a href="https://www.military.com/daily-news/2020/03/18/navy-eases-grooming-standards-limit-virus-exposure.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relaxed</a> its hair length grooming standards for sailors “due to COVID-19 force health protection measures maximizing social distancing.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>we’ll be keeping tabs on which of these “temporary” deregulatory policies become permanent. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MANUFACTURING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/president-trump-gm-continue-beef-ventilator-production?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What’s in a Tweet: President Trump vs. GM Edition
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, President Trump had this to say about General Motors:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/383/trump_tweet_about_gm.png" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="Trump tweet about GM"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><small><em>@realDonaldTrump</em></small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s break down what the president meant, what GM did in response, and what invoking P really means. Stop giggling. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Trump <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/27/trump-orders-general-motors-to-make-ventilators-under-defense-production-act.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">criticized GM</a> and CEO Mary Barra Friday morning for moving too slowly in cranking out ventilators. The U.S. is expected to require hundreds of thousands of ventilators to treat COVID-19 patients.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GM said yesterday it was already working on a joint venture with Ventec Life Systems to build ventilators at its plant in Indiana.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But the NYT reported earlier Friday that the automaker wanted </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/27/us/politics/coronavirus-trump-ventilators-gm-ventec.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">over $1 billion</a></span><span> from the government for roughly 80k breathing machines. That made FEMA reassess the arrangement. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Invoke “P”: </strong>Trump <a href="https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/489849-trump-lashes-out-at-gm-ford-over-ventilators?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">meant the DPA</a>, or Defense Production Act. The Korean War-era statute allows the White House to force companies to produce critical materials in disaster situations.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Next step:</strong> Friday afternoon, Trump formally ordered GM to make ventilators under the DPA. The company said the order doesn’t change its production plans. But after Trump’s beef with Barra last year over her plans to shutter five North American plants...things are tense.</p>

<tr>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Trump+formally+ordered+GM+to+make+ventilators+under+the+DPA%2C+but+it%27s+awkward+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/president-trump-gm-continue-beef-ventilator-production&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/apple-launches-new-covid19-website-app?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
An App a Day Keeps the COVID Away
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Apple Covid-19 app" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODEvYXBwbGVfY292aWQtMTlfYXBwLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Apple</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re tired of WebMD giving you the runaround, Apple yesterday <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/3/27/21197056/apple-coronavirus-covid-19-website-app-online-screening-tool-cdc?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched a website and app</a> dedicated to COVID-19 screening in collaboration with FEMA, the CDC, and the White House.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s no substitute for a cotton swab up your nose, but Apple’s new program quizzes you on your symptoms and recent travel to let you know when (or if) you should seek medical care or COVID-19 testing. It can’t guarantee you’ll get one of the high-demand, low-supply tests, though—only an NBA contract can do that. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple’s app joins a growing list of tech products aimed at informing you about the coronavirus.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A research app in the U.K. dedicated to collecting data on COVID-19 for medical professionals racked up </span><span><a href="https://techcrunch.com/2020/03/25/self-reporting-app-for-covid-19-symptoms-for-uk-research-sees-650k-downloads-in-24-hours/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">750,000 downloads</a></span><span> from Tuesday to Thursday.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon’s voice assistant Alexa and Alphabet's Verily unit can help answer COVID-19 questions.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>The tech community has mobilized in a big way during this crisis. Apple is also <span>donating 10 million face masks across the U.S. and Europe. </span></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F27%2Fapple-launches-new-covid19-website-app" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">

It’s a Wyoming Asphalt Sour Buyer’s Market
</font></a>
</h1>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="geopolitics" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8xNTMvb2lsLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Alternate quarantine side hustle idea in case no one pays for your premium TikToks: buying oil in markets suckerpunched by declining demand.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wyoming Asphalt Sour, a dense oil used to make paving bitumen, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-27/one-corner-of-u-s-oil-market-has-already-seen-negative-prices?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold at negative prices</a> in mid-March. As in, producers are paying buyers to take barrels off their hands.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How that happens: </strong>Unlike Facebook shares or Treasury bonds, oil is a physical commodity that needs to be stored somewhere once it’s pumped out of the ground. When storage costs climb high enough (or space runs out) producers <a href="https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/oil-price-could-fall-below-zero-analyst?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">might pay buyers</a> to take it.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Storage is an issue right now. With COVID-19 freezing economic activity, demand for crude has fallen off a cliff. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>That means reserves are filling up faster than the bar right after social distancing measures are lifted. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Wyoming Asphalt Sour was the first crude stream to flip negative, but it <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-19/the-idea-of-negative-oil-prices-is-more-realistic-than-you-think?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">might not be the last</a>. A handful of other North American crude grades are trading dangerously close to zero, Bloomberg reports.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</font></a>

</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We love writing all parts of this newsletter, but our favorite section recently is showcasing readers' stories about people helping each other in their neighborhoods. Here's the latest entry...</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Vicki in New Orleans, LA: </strong>“Families in our New Orleans neighborhood are posting the kids' artwork in their windows. It's a strolling gallery tour for those who are taking their daily walk.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Rachael in Fort Mill, SC: </strong>“My neighbors and I are taking turns dancing and waving outside of a senior living center every day at 4 to show the residents some love.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Lauren in Indianapolis, IN: </strong>“I was walking my pup in the neighborhood and a woman and two teenagers jumped out, ran to the door with birthday balloons and then proceeded to sing ‘Happy Birthday’ to their grandmother on her Ring.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You can always <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/20/ways-help-coronavirus-epidemic?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">check out our guide</a> on ways you can help with coronavirus relief efforts, or submit your own inspiring stories <a href="https://morningbrewdaily.typeform.com/to/yeQD9C?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SATURDAY HEADLINES
</h3>
</td>

</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In today’s edition of Saturday Headlines, we are highlighting companies that have made special products for coronavirus relief efforts. Three of the following are real stories, but one is made up. Can you spot the fake?</p>

style=\"color:#000\"\u003eStimulus: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe House passed and President Trump signed the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/2099a53bb8adf2def7ee7329ea322f9d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest economic relief bill\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in U.S. history, a $2.2 trillion whopper. $1,200 payouts and other financial assistance measures are on their way to many Americans who are suffering from a swift but crushing economic crisis. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGlobal economy: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt's \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/3bb2d6810c2f141a0bdecd3e4b49b215?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enow in a recession\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, said the head of the IMF.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eU.S. markets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDespite heavy losses on Friday, the major indexes posted historic weekly gains. The Dow had its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/26/stock-market-futures-open-to-close-news.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebest week\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since 1938, when there were more cars on the road than there are now.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Deregulation Station\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"stop signal with a coronavirus theme\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=447 src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/382/stop_and_go.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen you’re confronting both a) an economic crisis and b) a public health emergency, the last thing you want to do is trip on red tape. This week, the U.S. government relaxed regulations across a number of industries—but not without controversy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBanks get relief in the relief package\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe $2.2 trillion stimulus bill passed yesterday relaxes some financial crisis-era rules to keep banks lending in these credit-crunched times.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRegulators said banks could ignore a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-finance-202/2020/03/26/the-finance-202-banks-win-long-sought-deregulation-in-coronavirus-rescue-package/5e7be6e0602ff10d49ad4bc7/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etough new accounting rule\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that requires them to estimate future losses on loans. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSmaller banks won’t need to hold as much cash in reserve until the end of the year or the end of this crisis.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eEnvironmental monitoring\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Thursday, the EPA temporarily \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/45fdad55aaa3bccde3d09939c631c208?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelaxed enforcement\u003c/a\u003e of environmental rules on polluters like power plants and factories. Citing COVID-19, the agency said it wouldn’t penalize companies that violate the rules because of coronavirus-related challenges. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSupporters say it’s a sensible guideline in the face of uncertainty. Environmental leaders called it a “license to pollute.” \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eFast-tracking medical equipment\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou’ve heard stories of companies heroically rejiggering their assembly lines to churn out emergency medical products. It’s...a little more complicated than that. Regulators have needed to \u003ca href=\"https://www.fda.gov/news-events/press-announcements/coronavirus-covid-19-update-fda-continues-facilitate-access-crucial-medical-products-including?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eloosen rules\u003c/a\u003e over the production of some life-saving medical equipment. A few examples:  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe FDA won’t enforce its “premarket review” when factories like Ford’s that do not typically make ventilators start making ventilators.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDistillers that pivoted to make hand sanitizer received some waivers from the government. But ethanol producers sitting on millions of gallons of lower-grade alcohol are \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://wwl.radio.com/articles/ethanol-industry-asks-for-relaxed-regulations-for-sanitizer?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill petitioning\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the FDA to let them help out in the effort.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFun note: \u003c/strong\u003eBecause of the coronavirus, we might even start seeing some midshipmen with mullets. The Navy \u003ca href=\"https://www.military.com/daily-news/2020/03/18/navy-eases-grooming-standards-limit-virus-exposure.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erelaxed\u003c/a\u003e its hair length grooming standards for sailors “due to COVID-19 force health protection measures maximizing social distancing.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ewe’ll be keeping tabs on which of these “temporary” deregulatory policies become permanent. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/27/president-trump-gm-continue-beef-ventilator-production?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nWhat’s in a Tweet: President Trump vs. GM Edition\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, President Trump had this to say about General Motors:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/383/trump_tweet_about_gm.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"Trump tweet about GM\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003e@realDonaldTrump\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s break down what the president meant, what GM did in response, and what invoking P really means. Stop giggling. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eTrump \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/03/27/trump-orders-general-motors-to-make-ventilators-under-defense-production-act.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecriticized GM\u003c/a\u003e and CEO Mary Barra Friday morning for moving too slowly in cranking out ventilators. The U.S. is expected to require hundreds of thousands of ventilators to treat COVID-19 patients.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGM said yesterday it was already working on a joint venture with Ventec Life Systems to build ventilators at its plant in Indiana.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut the NYT reported earlier Friday that the automaker wanted \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/27/us/politics/coronavirus-trump-ventilators-gm-ventec.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eover $1 billion\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from the government for roughly 80k breathing machines. That made FEMA reassess the arrangement. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInvoke “P”: \u003c/strong\u003eTrump \u003ca href=\"https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/489849-trump-lashes-out-at-gm-ford-over-ventilators?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emeant the DPA\u003c/a\u003e, or Defense Production Act. The Korean War-era statute allows the White House to force companies to produce critical materials in disaster situations.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNext step:\u003c/strong\u003e Friday afternoon, Trump formally ordered GM to make ventilators under the DPA. The company said the order doesn’t change its production plans. But after Trump’s beef with Barra last year over her plans to shutter five North American plants...things are tense.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold at negative prices\u003c/a\u003e in mid-March. As in, producers are paying buyers to take barrels off their hands.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow that happens: \u003c/strong\u003eUnlike Facebook shares or Treasury bonds, oil is a physical commodity that needs to be stored somewhere once it’s pumped out of the ground. When storage costs climb high enough (or space runs out) producers \u003ca href=\"https://www.foxbusiness.com/markets/oil-price-could-fall-below-zero-analyst?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emight pay buyers\u003c/a\u003e to take it.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStorage is an issue right now. With COVID-19 freezing economic activity, demand for crude has fallen off a cliff. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThat means reserves are filling up faster than the bar right after social distancing measures are lifted. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eWyoming Asphalt Sour was the first crude stream to flip negative, but it \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-19/the-idea-of-negative-oil-prices-is-more-realistic-than-you-think?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emight not be the last\u003c/a\u003e. A handful of other North American crude grades are trading dangerously close to zero, Bloomberg reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\"
